content.webTitle: Championship roundup: Birmingham hammer Reading by five

fields.headline: Championship roundup: Birmingham hammer Reading by five
fields.bodyText: Birmingham City 6-1 Reading Gary Rowett praised his promising teenager Demarai Gray for ending his scoring struggle with a hat-trick in a dramatic demolition of Reading. “He was so clinical. We toyed with him this week about how many goals he’s actually scored. He said ‘one’, and you could see on his face a look of disgust with himself. So I’m really pleased for him. We were ruthless here: we took virtually every chance we had.” Reading’s Nigel Adkins said: “It was very, very close in terms of the game, but not in terms of the scoreline. We’ll reflect on it.” Brentford 3-1 Blackburn Rovers The Brentford manager, Mark Warburton, tipped his striker Andre Gray to reach the top after his ninth goal of the season helped sink fellow promotion hopefuls Blackburn. “He loves scoring and that’s a big part of the character of a centre-forward. Can we keep him? Everyone has a price. The owner will decide the price. That’s life, but right now this is a good place to be. I think anyone would think long and hard before leaving.” Gary Bowyer said: “It’s a major disappointment, we came here to win … but Brentford are a club on the rise.” And the rest Ipswich missed the chance to go top with a 0-0 draw at Bolton. ■ An 89th-minute Steven Davies equaliser gave Blackpool a 2-2 draw at Charlton. ■ Fulham beat Leeds 1-0 at Elland Road via a Hugo Rodallega strike. ■ Norwich thumped 10-man Huddersfield 5-0. ■ Rotherham drew 0-0 with Forest. ■ And Leon Clarke struck as Wolves beat Sheffield Wednesday 1-0.
